title: Reign earn draw with Dash as Sofia Huerta breaks NWSL assist record
description: Her assist on Jordyn Huitema’s game-tying goal was the record 32nd of her career in the regular season.
content:
Playing on the road in Houston, the Seattle Reign recovered from a one-goal deficit and earned a 1-1 draw with the Dash to pick up a standings point.

Forward Jordyn Huitema found the game-tying goal in the 65th minute, assisted by defender Sofia Huerta, who now owns the all-time NWSL assist record with 32.

After the sweltering Houston heat forced a brief delay, the Reign and Dash were off to the races. Houston got a quick start with Messiah Bright nearly getting in on goal in the opening minutes of the match, but things quickly settled down as the match progressed and went into halftime scoreless.

The second half got off to a hot start, as a mistake by the Reign led to a Houston goal from the foot of Yazmeen Ryan.

Up a goal at home, Houston was happy to take control of the tempo of the match.

However, the Reign found an equalizer against the run of play in the 65th minute. Huerta served a ball into the box, over the heads of Houston’s backline from the right side of the field. Huitema, who was making a run into the box, got on the inside of her mark and headed the ball confidently into the back of the net.

The home team continued to threaten for nearly the entirety of the second half, forcing the Reign to defend sharply to keep the march level. Claudia Dickey was called on to make a save in the 75th minute, as Ryan unleashed a shot from distance and forced Dickey to tip it over the bar. The Reign hunkered down through the final whistle, hanging onto the draw and bringing one point back to Seattle.
• Edgar Leon scored for the visiting Seattle U men (0-2) in a 2-1 loss to North Carolina.
• Jadyn Holdenried scored on an assist from Samiah Shell as the Washington women (2-0-2) remained unbeaten early in the season, playing to a 1-1 draw with host UC Irvine.
• The Seattle U women (1-0-1) played to a 1-1 draw with Denver at the Rumble in the Rockies event in Missoula, Mont.
• Emerson Hancock pitched one clean inning of relief, striking out one in the Tacoma Rainiers’ 6-3 loss to the visiting Oklahoma City Comets.

Blake Hunt and Victor Labrada each drove in a run, and MilesMastrobuoni went 2 for 3 with a run scored for Tacoma (70-56).
• Tai Peete had an RBI triple, but the host Everett AquaSox (56-64) fell to Spokane 5-1.
summary: The Seattle Reign women's soccer team earned a 1-1 draw with Houston Dash, coming back from a one-goal deficit to equalize. The goal was scored by forward Jordyn Huitema, assisted by defender Sofia Huerta, who now holds the all-time NWSL assist record with 32. The match was played without a score for the first time since 1999. Despite a strong second half, Houston managed to take control of the match. The Reign managed to hang onto their lead until the final whistle, bringing one point back to Seattle.
shortSummary: The Seattle Reign drew 1-1 with Houston Dash in Houston, with goals from Jordyn Huitema and Sofia Huerta, securing a standings point.
argos_summary: Seattle Reign salvaged a 1-1 draw against the Houston Dash, with Jordyn Huitema scoring the equalizer after a 32-assist record‑setting assist from defender Sofia Huerta. Houston had taken the lead early in the second half through Yazmeen Ryan, but the Reign held on to earn a point. In other Seattle sports news, the Seattle U men lost 2-1 to North Carolina, the Washington women remained unbeaten with a 1-1 draw against UC Irvine, and the Seattle U women also drew 1-1 with Denver at the Rumble in the Rockies. Additionally, Tacoma Rainiers’ pitcher Emerson Hancock recorded a clean inning in a 6-3 loss to Oklahoma City, while Everett AquaSox fell 5-1 to Spokane with Tai Peete hitting an RBI triple.
